title: Attitude-Based Learner Profile Analysis and Personalized Language Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level knowledge and practical experience in the relevant field
context.additional_context: An environment requiring customized education design based on learner attitudes using mixed-methods research and latent profile analysis. Reflects learners' preference for non-formal learning environments similar to MOOCs

learning_goals: Learners can self-diagnose their attitude profiles (inquiry-driven vs. instructor-directed) through a 10-week learning process
Learners can quantitatively evaluate cognitive, affective, and behavioral attitude changes during language learning
Learners can select and apply optimized learning strategies (autonomous inquiry or structured task completion) based on their attitude types through project-based activities
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
